name: Reporting
desc: Thank you so much for coming to NDITC-init ^_^ We hope that you will enjoy the fest as much as we enjoyed organizing it.

name: Opening Ceremony
desc: The Opening Ceremony will be held on 9.00 AM, 23 November 2018

name: Wall Magazine Display
desc:
A team of maximum 3 members are allowed to display a wall magazine.
There is no specific size for a wall magazine or scrapbook; participants are permitted to display wall magazines of any standard size.
The wall magazines should be themed on topics related to IT.
Wall Magazines have to be submitted on 22 November 2018.

name: Project Display
desc:
A team of maximum 3 members are allowed to display a project.
Participants are requested to be present at the venue with their projects at least an hour before the reporting time according to the schedule.
The projects will be divided into 2 (two) divisions: * Junior (for Class 6-10) * Senior (for Class 11-12)
A team comprising of students from different institutions is not allowed. One team must comprise of the students of the same institution.
The participants must bring all necessary electronic equipment (Multi-plugs, Laptops, Flash Drive etc). The authority will not provide these equipment.

name: Programming Contest
desc:
There will be an online preliminary contest in which teams of maximum 2 participants will participate. (Note that your team can consist of only you if you can't find a partner or want to compete alone.)
Contestants from different institutions can pair up to make a team.
10 teams will be selected. The preliminary contest will be hosted at codeforces(codeforces.com).
Selected contestants will be invited to our fest to compete on the final rounds.
Contest format will follow the format of IOI.
Subtasks will be present.
The final round will go on for 3 hours.

name: Webpage Designing
desc:
A maximum of 3 participants are allowed for each web page design.
The page must embed a theme related to technology.All necessary electronic equipments (Laptop, Flash Drive etc.) must be brought by the participants. The authority will not provide these equipments.
Participants have to submit their designs on 22 November 2018 according to the schedule.

name: Digital Poster Design Showcase
desc:
We don't do Photo Exhibition. We do Digital Poster Exhibition. 
Here are the rules-
a) A participant is allowed to submit a maximum of 3 posters.
b) The poster should have an IT based theme. 
c) Each poster should not exceed the limit of 15 words. 
e) Participants have to email the soft copy of their posters along with their information (Name, Institution, Topic and a Short description of the Poster) and three copies of each poster in JPEG, PNG and PDF format.
f) Please send them within 21 November, 2018.f) There will be a primary selection. 
g) The selected posters will be exhibited throughout our event.

name: Informatics Olympiad
desc:
This version of Olympiad is for the true geeks out there. Big shout out to you all. 
Here are the rules-
a) Participants must report at least 20 minutes before the scheduled time. 
b) There will be two levels for Informatics Olympiad- *Junior (Class 9-10), *Senior (Class 11-12).
c) The questions are probably going to be really hard.

name: IT Olympiad
desc:
The easier version. Here are the rules-
a) Participants must report at least 20 minutes before the scheduled time. 
b) There won't be any level for the IT Olympiad.
c) The question are probably going to be really easy

name: Ideacon
desc:
This event is for those who have ideas for projects, but canâ€™t build a prototype.
You will get a stage to present your ideas. You will get 10 minutes to present your idea.
The presentation can be done either in English or Bengali. You can bring any type of illustration or demonstration you need to help you present your ideas.

name: Hackathon
desc:
The solutions have to be genuine and not replicated from anywhere else.
A team may consist of maximum 5 members and all of the members will have to be present during the hackathon.
A team will work on only one idea or problem statement.
Team members can come from different schools and colleges.
Participants will have to bring their own laptop and other necessary equipment (internet access will be provided via WiFi).

name: Line Follower Robot Competition - Preli
Line Follower Robot Competition - Final
Code Debugging Preliminary
desc:
Participants will be given one C++, one Python and one JavaScript code. These codes may contain multiple logical problems.
Participants will be given a set of objectives and each objective may have different marks. There will be no partial points.
The participant will have 2 hours to debug the codes.
Internet access will not be allowed in the event.
The provided computers will have gdb and Firefox pre-installed in case any participant wants to use that.

name: Code Debugging Final
desc:
Participants will be given one C++, one Python and one JavaScript code. These codes may contain multiple logical problems.
Participants will be given a set of objectives and each objective may have different marks. There will be no partial points.
The participant will have 2 hours to debug the codes.
Internet access will not be allowed in the event.
The provided computers will have gdb and Firefox pre-installed in case any participant wants to use that.

name: Workshop by GIGABYTE: HOW TO BUILD A PC
Lunch Break
desc: Lunch and snacks will be provided for the participants who will stay for whole day or long events.

name: IT Based Presentation
desc:
Each team can contain a maximum of 2 members.
The presentations should be on IT-based topics.
Participants will get a maximum of 5 minutes to describe their presentation.
All necessary electronic equipments (Laptop, Multi-plugs, and Flash Drive etc.) are to be brought by the participants. The authority will not provide these equipments.
A participant will be given another chance and 10 minutes to recover in case of sudden electronic failure or any kind of unintentional incident.
The slides must not contain any audio.

name: Prize Giving Ceremony
desc: The prize giving ceremony will be held on the last day of the event (24 November, 2018).
